description: Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss. A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear. Landing attacks slightly restores HP.
location: On a guarded Carriage being towed by two Trolls in Altus Plateau, travelling on the road southwest of the Road of Iniquity Side Path Site of Grace .; As of patch 1.06, this weapon is also dropped by Magnus the Beast Claw upon defeat .; Video location

name: Devourer's Scepter
description: Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. This weapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of  Blasphemy. One of the legendary armaments. A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final moments before being devoured by the great serpent.
location: Dropped by Knight/Recusant Bernahl when defeated. You will find him at Warmaster's Shack or in Crumbling Farum Azula when he invades you. Video Location

name: Brick Hammer
description: Large iron warhammer designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.
location: Located at Stormveil Castle.; In the Wine Cellar - Use the Rusty Key to access the ladder behind a locked wooden door to reach the top floor of the Wine Cellar. Climb the ladder and go right. Hop across the floor until you reach the outside rafters, and follow them. Found on a corpse hanging over a ledge leading back into the Wine Cellar.; Video Location

name: Whip
description: A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain. Through its supple attacks cannot be thwarted by parrying or even guarding, it is incapable of dealing critical hits.
location: Found in Castle Morne near the Rampart Gaol Site of Grace; The building is first accessed by walking atop the western wall of the castle. Look to the left for a building with a blue roof. Jump onto this roof and then jump down to the cliffs below. Follow the cliffs southeast until you return to a section of the castle with a big square opening. Descend into the opening by landing on the wooden beams. There is a corpse with a Smithing Stone on one of the beams and there are several Rats and a Misbegotten at the ground level. The corpse with the whip is sitting against a wall. Video Location

name: Rotten Battle Hammer
description: Large iron warhammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike. Skill: Braggart's Roar Declare your presence with a boastful roar. Raises attack power, defense, and stamina recovery speed.
location: Guaranteed drop from a Rotten Duelist enemy in the stone coffins northwest of the Consecrated Snowfield Site of Grace.

name: Thorned Whip
description: Hefty whip coverd in crimson thorns. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. A device of fearsome religious encouragement, it is fashioned in the image of the briars of fin.  Very effective at inflicting blood loss.
location: Possible drop from Fire Prelate wielding it north of Giants' Mountaintop Catacombs entrance (northeast of Zamor Ruins, just before the long narrow bridge).

name: Magma Whip Candlestick
description: This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir. When wielded as a weapon, the flames become supple whips of lava.
location: Rewarded by Patches in Volcano Manor after completing his assassination quest, Great Horned Tragoth, for him.; This must be done before Patches departs from the manor, it is lost otherwise.; Video Location

name: Hoslow's Petal Whip
description: Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down though the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow. High dexterity is required to wield this weapon, but it excels at inflicting devastation
location: Dropped by Juno Hoslow, along with Hoslow's Set as part of the final contract for the Volcano Manor questline. His red summon sign be found in the northern Mountaintops of the Giants, east of Shack of the Lofty.; Dropped by Diallos Hoslow, either at the end of his questline in Jarburg, or if provoked and killed outside of a truce-zone in Liurnia of the Lakes or Jarburg.

name: Giant's Red Braid
description: Hefty whip woven from the flame-red hair of a Fire Giant. Every giant is red of hair, and Radagon was said to have despised his own red locks. Perhaps that was a curse of their kind.
location: Weapon Skill: Flame Dance; This weapon cannot be infused with Ashes of War; Can't be buffed by Magic or Consumables; Giant's Red Braid can be upgraded by using Somber Smithing Stones; Sell Value: 1000; NOTE: As of Patch 1.09, the scaling values of this weapon were changed. Please refer to the Upgrades Table of this weapon below.; NOTE: Patch 1.13 Increased poise damage of dual wield attacks of all Whips (in PVP); One of the two fire-based whips in Elden Ring, the other being the Magma Whip Candlestick. However, the Giant's Red Braid is more suited towards STR/FTH builds, while the Magma Whip Candlestick is better suited for DEX/FTH builds.

name: Urumi
description: This weapon made of extremely thin, flexible blades of metal is wielded like a whip by Nightfold warriors. Though in essence a whip with a cutting edge, it can also be used as a spear to pierce foes.
location: Caria Manor, From the Manor Upper Level Grace, take the elevator down, and head straight while looking left. You should see a rampart below with a wooden ledge and a corpse hanging from it. Jump down to it. Head southwest down the ramp and to your left you should see the Urumi guarded by four Fingercreepers. Video Location
